Про эту игру и так все знают поэтому расскажу рецепт СЫРНИКОВ

Время подготовки 7 минут
Время приготовления 10 минут
Порции 2
ИНГРЕДИЕНТЫ
400 г Творог (9 % жирности)
1 шт. Яйцо
3 ст. л. Мука (и дополнительно для панировки)
3 ст. л. Сахар
3-4 ст. л. Подсолнечное масло для жарки
1 щепотка Соль
10 г ванильный сахар
1.Творог (400 г) переложите в небольшую стеклянную или пластиковую миску. Добавьте щепотку соли, одно яйцо, 3 ст. л. сахара, и 10 г ванильного сахара. Я не люблю, чтобы сырники были очень сладкими, но вы можете добавить немного больше сахара, например 4 ст. л. Творог для сырников можно использовать как базарный, так и магазинный. Главное, чтобы он был не кислым и сильно влажным. Если используете магазинный творог, то берите творог в мягких полиэтиленовых пакетах.
2.После того, как вы положите все ингредиенты в миску, перемешайте их до получения однородной массы. Для этого лучше всего использовать обычную вилку, ложку или толкушку для картофеля.
3.К полученной творожной смеси добавьте 3 ст. л. пшеничной муки. Если творог оказался достаточно мокрым, то добавьте на одну столовую ложку муки больше. Но главное не переборщить, чтобы сырники получились нежными.
4.Смочите руки небольшим количеством подсолнечного масла и скатайте из творожной массы небольшие шарики диаметром 3-4 см. Приплюсните шарики руками, чтобы получились красивые небольшие сырники.
5.Теперь запанируйте сырники в муке, чтобы они не потеряли форму и зажарились до аппетитной корочки.
6.Разогрейте антипригарную сковородку с 3-4 ст. л. подсолнечного масла на среднем огне. Сковородка для сырников должна хорошо разогреться. Не уменьшайте огонь при жарке, так у вас получится идеальная прожарка. Следите, чтобы сырники не пригорели. Для того, чтобы получить красивейшую золотистую корочку я обжаривал сырники по 2-3 минуты с каждой стороны. Но у вас может уйти немного больше или меньше времени.
7.Чтобы удалить лишнее масло с готовых сырников, переложите их сначала на бумажное полотенце. Затем переложите сырники в тарелки для подачи, посыпьте немного сахарной пудрой, добавьте варенье или сметану.

This game is surprisingly addictive, although I prefer Half Life 2 in nearly every aspect, the gunplay of this game is awesome, and highly captivating. The game itself, though still being fairly good, is quite dated, and I find some parts to be pretty confusing at times. Despite this, Half Life has some of the best combat I can say I've experienced. Some people call the combat boring or repetitive, I call it diverse and unique; the game can be quite difficult at times, especially in chapters like Surface Tension. On my first playthrough, I found some sections to be utterly unfair, but after you understand why you keep failing, you'll keep trying new strategies and eventually find a very satisfying way of completing the arenas. I love the game, and especially it's legacy on gaming, would recommend, prepare for some tough fights, and prepare for unforseen consequences.
I mean its one of the greatest games ever made its the reason steam is here today. If you havent played it I'm truly sorry for your loss.

2021년에도 왜 갓겜인지 확실히 알 수 있다 여러가지 퍼즐에 다양한 무기들로 재미있고 전략을 급조할 수 있는 전투
심심하다 싶으면 새로운게 계속해서 튀어나오고 방대한 블랙메사 연구소는 다양한 테마들을 보여줘 질리지 않는다
젠 부분을 급하게 끝내 부족하다는데 짧은 볼륨과 부족함들이 조금 느껴지긴해도 블랙메사 연구소에 비해서는 충분히 재미있다 배경 디자인은 그래픽 퀄리티만 높았으면 경악할만큼 세련되고 맵 디자인의 기이함과 배경이 섞여 색다르게 다가온다
최종보스전의 포스가 조금 아쉽긴 했지만 텔레포트로 나오는 공간들은 매력적이었다 특히 착시를 만드는 점프맵은 볼만했다

First off let me say that I went into this game thinking: "I already know how the second game ends, but I'll play this anyways. What the heck. I got it in a bundle for 24 bucks, and it included ALL the others. Might as well start with the original".

Let me just say that I went in expecting something good. Maybe I had my expectations a little to high.
But this game is just amazing.
Can I say that it's one of the best games I've ever played? If you took away the nightmare that was Xen, then yes.
The thing I loved the most about Half-Life is how much variety and content there was in it. The beginning was a bit slow, but when things picked up, they REALLY picked up. Each area felt new and exciting. Every part from the labs to the above ground areas, even the monstrosity of game design that was the alien planet was an amazing place to be in. The amount of places that are in Half-Life were so numerous that it really felt like a long journey. And don't even get me started on the ingenious scripted events. Those were what carried the immersion for me. I would have been bored out of my skull watching the events that unfolded as cut scenes, but making them live and in front of you just made it so much better.
I only really have two things that ruined the game:
First is the fact that if you manually save instead of letting the game auto save, you can just kind of prance around and load the save game over and over before you end up beating the level. That was my own fault, but to new players, I'd recommend using auto saves until you reach Xen, then  save every 5 seconds. Trust me. [spoiler] Especially during the final boss [/spoiler].
Second, I looked up how to beat the game with walk through videos and guides. DON'T DO THIS AT ALL UNTIL YOU GET TO XEN. PLEASE don't look things up, I am BEGGING you. Once you reach the alien planet, use as many guides you can get your grubby little hands on, because it's by far the blemish on the finely polished car. Just take my word for it and try to figure stuff out for yourself.
I really enjoyed Half-Life. It's not my FAVORITE game ever, but it's easily up there with the portal games, Mario Odyssey, and Garry's Mod. Can't wait to play the sequel
(My current computer can't run Half-Life 2, so I have to wait until I get a new computer to play it.)

It's half life. Of course it's awesome. This game is just revolutionary. Before half life, fps games had minimal story and dropped you right into the action (not that that's a bad thing, I actually prefer doom over half life.) but this game changed everything. This is just about the first fps to have a real atmosphere, complex puzzles, and an actual story. This game set up one of the best franchises in gaming history, and I can't commend valve enough for this phenomenal experience. This game is kinda hit or miss at times, but when it hits it REALLY hits, but for the most part the levels are amazing (except for a few levels, and... all of xen,) and they all lead into each other so seamlessly. The combat isn't the best part of the game, but it's still GREAT. The hecu will always be more satisfying to kill than the combine. It feels like the game gives you enough health and ammo to just be comfortable and not have to constantly scrounge around and be stuck below 25 health constantly, at least on normal. This game is a 9.5/10 for me, the main thing holding it back for me is xen, and a few levels *cough cough* *on a rail* *cough cough*. even still, I can't recommend this game enough.

This game is a classic for a reason. My experience with the original Half-Life started with the words "It came out in 1998, it can't be that good." and I was completely incorrect. While the scientists and security guards are more funny nowadays than immersive or realistic, I still enjoy the campy 'science voice' the VA uses for them (Coomer is of course a highlight). This game pretty much laid the foundations for every good first-person shooter following its release- both in narrative and gameplay- and this is for very good reason. You ARE Gordon, you can listen carefully to what the scientists have to say and try to save as many of them as possible (lol) or you could completely ignore them and shoot every scientist and security guard in the face mid-exposition dump and figure it out on your own. Everything you do in this game you do as yourself. Gordon never takes control away from you, there is never any text on the screen that tells you what to do, there is no minimap or compass or objective reminders, just "Hey that scientist said something about the generator before I got bored and shot him in the face, I'll head there". The design in Half-Life (and hopefully its sequel) is extremely refreshing to play in today's climate, and is really an extremely fun romp through a destroyed lab and a fun little apocalyptic scenario to boot. This is a must-buy for anyone who has not played it and certainly a library essential.
